Class RMIClient

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
org.example.galaxy_trucker.ClientServer.RMI.RMIClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Remote, ClientInterface
public class RMIClient extends UnicastRemoteObject implements ClientInterface
Represents a Remote Method Invocation (RMI) client that interacts with a remote server and interfaces with a game client. This class handles establishing connections, managing ping monitoring with the server, receiving commands and events, and enabling interactive client-to-server communication for an RMI-based application. This class extends the UnicastRemoteObject to allow communication over RMI and implements the ClientInterface for client-side functionalities.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • RMIClient

      public RMIClient(Client client) throws RemoteException
      Constructs a new RMIClient instance.
      Parameters:
      client - the client instance that this RMIClient will use for communication.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a remote communication error occurs.

  • Method Details

    • receivePing

      public void receivePing() throws RemoteException
      Handles the reception of a ping message from the server. Updates the last known ping time to the current system time and notifies the server by sending a pong response.
      Specified by:
      receivePing in interface ClientInterface
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a remote communication error occurs while sending the pong response.

    • startPingMonitor

      public void startPingMonitor()
      Starts the ping monitor that periodically checks the time of the last received ping and detects connection loss if no ping is received within a defined threshold. If a scheduler is already running, it is terminated before starting a new one. The monitoring process is executed at fixed intervals using a single-threaded scheduled executor. If the time since the last ping exceeds 10 seconds, the connection is considered lost, and a disconnection handling routine is triggered. This might include cleaning up resources and attempting reconnection. The ping monitor operates autonomously in a separate thread provided by the executor service.

    • setCommandInterpreter

      public void setCommandInterpreter(CommandInterpreter commandInterpreter)
      Sets the command interpreter for the RMIClient.
      Parameters:
      commandInterpreter - the CommandInterpreter instance to be set for handling commands

    • StartClient

      public void StartClient() throws IOException, NotBoundException
      Starts the client by initializing necessary components and entering an input loop. This method performs the following steps: 1. Calls the `setup` method to establish initial connections and configurations. If the setup fails, the application exits with a status code of 1. 2. Initializes and starts a daemon thread to handle user input and server communication. The input handling loop is executed in a separate thread to allow asynchronous processing of user commands and server responses.
      Specified by:
      StartClient in interface ClientInterface
      Throws:
      IOException - if any I/O error occurs during setup or input processing.
      NotBoundException - if the expected server interface is not bound in the RMI registry during the setup process.

    • receiveMessage

      public void receiveMessage(Event event)
      Receives and handles an incoming event. This method delegates the processing of the event to the client by invoking the receiveEvent method on the client instance. If an exception occurs during the event processing, it is caught and an error message is logged indicating the issue.
      Specified by:
      receiveMessage in interface ClientInterface
      Parameters:
      event - the event to be received and processed. The event must implement the Event interface and comply with the Visitor design pattern.

    • receiveToken

      public void receiveToken(String token) throws RemoteException
      Receives a token and processes it by updating the command interpreter, gameboard view, and triggering a token-related event. This method sets the token in the associated CommandInterpreter, updates the client's gameboard to reflect the current level provided by the command interpreter, and generates a TokenEvent containing the token for further handling.
      Specified by:
      receiveToken in interface ClientInterface
      Parameters:
      token - the token string to be processed. It serves as a unique identifier or access token within the system.
      Throws:
      RemoteException - if a remote communication error occurs during the method execution.

    • inputLoop

      public void inputLoop() throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Handles the main input loop for user commands. Depending on the input, various actions such as reconnecting, creating or joining a game, viewing logs, or interacting with boards can be performed.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an input or output exception occurs during the loop's operations.
      InterruptedException - If the thread running the input loop is interrupted.
